workouts.name: Day 1 — Upper Strength + Arms
workouts.description: Push/Pull focus with arm work and shoulder-safe exercises

exercises.name: Lat/Teres Release
exercises.notes: Use a ball against the wall, rolling along the outer armpit and side rib cage. Frees tissues limiting overhead mobility.

exercises.name: Wall Lat Press
exercises.notes: Stand facing wall, elbows at shoulder height. Press gently while allowing ribs to expand.

exercises.name: Serratus Wall Slides
exercises.notes: Forearms on wall, slide upward while pushing shoulder blades forward. Trains upward rotation, reduces impingement risk.

exercises.name: Band External Rotations
exercises.notes: Elbow tucked to ribs, rotate hand outward against band. Strengthens rotator cuff, improves humeral stability.

exercises.name: Low-Incline DB Press
exercises.notes: Bench at 15–30°. Press with elbows tucked 30°. Safer on shoulder, loads chest well.

exercises.name: Chest-Supported DB Row
exercises.notes: Chest on incline bench. Row dumbbells toward hip. Protects spine, lets upper back do all the work.

exercises.name: One-Arm Cable Row
exercises.notes: Neutral grip, pull elbow toward pocket. Great for fixing left–right imbalance.

exercises.name: Cable Chest Press (neutral)
exercises.notes: Neutral grip cable press. Smooth resistance avoids joint irritation.

exercises.name: Serratus Cable Punch
exercises.notes: Extend arm fully while letting shoulder blade glide forward. Best exercise for fixing shoulder elevation limitations.

exercises.name: Hammer Curls
exercises.notes: Neutral grip curl reduces strain on ulnar nerve. Ideal when standard curls cause nerve symptoms.

exercises.name: Cable Tricep Pushdown
exercises.notes: Elbows pinned to sides, push bar or rope down. Minimal elbow flare — good for sensitive nerve pathways.

exercises.name: Dead Bug
exercises.notes: Opposite arm/leg extension while keeping ribs down. Builds deep core stability.

exercises.name: Side Plank
exercises.notes: Knees or feet stacked. Strengthens obliques and lateral core.

exercises.name: Telephone Waiter Glide
exercises.notes: Arm abducted ~90°, wrist extended slightly, head tilts away. STOP if tingling occurs.

workouts.name: Day 2 — Conditioning + Knee Rehab
workouts.description: Court work with knee rehabilitation focus

exercises.name: Glute Med Walk
exercises.notes: Band around ankles or knees. Step sideways under control. Trains hip stabilizers.

exercises.name: Tibialis Raises
exercises.notes: Lean against wall, lift toes upward. Strengthens tibialis anterior for knee tracking.

exercises.name: Hip Airplanes
exercises.notes: Hinge on one leg while opening/closing hips. 5 reps per side.

exercises.name: Step-Downs
exercises.notes: Control descent while keeping knee aligned over second toe. Retrains knee tracking.

exercises.name: Single-Leg RDL
exercises.notes: Hip hinge on one leg with slight knee bend. Strengthens glute/hamstring, improves balance.

exercises.name: Band Lateral Walks
exercises.notes: Glute activation drill. Keeps pelvis stable during cutting and squatting.

exercises.name: Dribbling
exercises.notes: Court work - ball handling practice

exercises.name: Shooting
exercises.notes: Court work - shooting practice

exercises.name: Conditioning
exercises.notes: Court work - conditioning drills

exercises.name: Post-Conditioning Free Throws
exercises.notes: Practice free throws while fatigued

exercises.name: Thread the Needle
exercises.notes: Thoracic rotation mobility drill

exercises.name: Child's Pose Side Bend
exercises.notes: Lat and side body stretch

exercises.name: Gentle Lat Stretch
exercises.notes: Light lat stretch — don't overdo it

workouts.name: Day 3 — Heavy Lower + Athletic Strength
workouts.description: Main lower body strength day with sled work

exercises.name: Band Lateral Walks
exercises.notes: Glute activation drill. Keeps pelvis stable.

exercises.name: Tibialis Raises
exercises.notes: Lean against wall, lift toes upward. Strengthens tibialis anterior.

exercises.name: Hip Hinge Patterning
exercises.notes: Practice the hip hinge movement pattern before heavy lifts

exercises.name: Light Sled Drag
exercises.notes: Warm-up sled work — 20m

exercises.name: Trap Bar Deadlift
exercises.notes: Neutral grip deadlift reduces spinal shear and shoulder stress. Ideal main lift.

exercises.name: Reverse Sled Drag
exercises.notes: Walk backward pulling sled. Massive quad builder with almost zero joint load. 20–40m per set.

exercises.name: Hamstring Curl
exercises.notes: Seated or lying curl. Strengthens hamstrings to balance quad load.

exercises.name: Quad Extension (VMO focus)
exercises.notes: Light, controlled quad extensions focusing on top 20° of ROM. Targets VMO.

exercises.name: Lateral Sled Drag
exercises.notes: Sideways movement strengthening glute med. 20m each side.

exercises.name: Sled Push (Optional)
exercises.notes: Leg drive conditioning with stable knee angles. 15–20m per set.

exercises.name: Pallof Press
exercises.notes: Anti-rotation press that strengthens obliques and spinal stabilizers.

exercises.name: Marching Farmer Carry
exercises.notes: Farmer carry with high knee march. 20m per set.

workouts.name: Day 4 — PT + Mobility + Posterior Chain
workouts.description: Recovery day focusing on mobility, stability, and posterior chain

exercises.name: Thoracic Rotations
exercises.notes: Gentle thoracic spine rotation — 8 reps per side

exercises.name: Child's Pose Side Bend
exercises.notes: Lat and side body stretch — 20s per side

exercises.name: Rib Expand Overhead Reach
exercises.notes: Focus on ribcage expansion — 5 deep breaths

exercises.name: Wall Lat Press
exercises.notes: Stand facing wall, elbows at shoulder height. Press gently while allowing ribs to expand.

exercises.name: Quadruped Rockback + Reach
exercises.notes: Rock hips back while reaching one arm forward. Improves scapular control and shoulder flexion.

exercises.name: Bear Hold
exercises.notes: Quadruped position with knees barely off floor. Trains cross-body stability.

exercises.name: Incline Plank
exercises.notes: Hands elevated on bench. Builds core stability without shoulder irritation.

exercises.name: Pallof Press + Torque
exercises.notes: Anti-rotation press with added rotation component.

exercises.name: Cable Pull-Throughs
exercises.notes: Hip hinge with cable behind you. Loads glutes/hamstrings safely.

exercises.name: Step-Down Reinforcement
exercises.notes: Lighter step-down work to reinforce proper knee tracking pattern.

exercises.name: GHD Back Extensions
exercises.notes: Hinge at hips, not spine. Strengthens glutes, hamstrings, spinal erectors.

exercises.name: Telephone Waiter Glide
exercises.notes: Arm abducted ~90°, wrist extended slightly, head tilts away. STOP if tingling occurs.

exercises.name: Wrist–Elbow Glide
exercises.notes: Elbow flexes while wrist extends, then reverse. Low-tension nerve flossing.
